mchorse.mappet.api.scripts.user

Interface IScriptWorld


  • public interface IScriptWorld
    This interface represent a world passed in the event. 
    
    function main(c)
    {
        var world = c.getWorld();

        // Do something with world...
    }

    • Method Detail

      • getMinecraftWorld

        World getMinecraftWorld()
        Get Minecraft world instance. BEWARE: you need to know the MCP mappings in order to directly call methods on this instance! 
        
 function main(c)
 {
     var seaLevel = c.getWorld().getMinecraftWorld().field_181546_a //Sea level

     c.send(seaLevel)
 }

      • setGameRule

        void setGameRule(java.lang.String gameRule,
                 java.lang.Object value)
        Set a game rule to a given value. 
        
   c.getWorld().setGameRule("keepInventory", true); //btw you can NOT write 1 instead of true
   c.getWorld().setGameRule("randomTickSpeed", 100);
        Parameters:
        gameRule - The name of the game rule to be set.
        value - The value to set the game rule to. The type of the value should match the expected type for the game rule.

      • getGameRule

        java.lang.Object getGameRule(java.lang.String gameRule)
        Get a game rule value. 
        
   var keepInventory = c.getWorld().getGameRule("keepInventory");
   var randomTickSpeed = c.getWorld().getGameRule("randomTickSpeed");

   c.send("Keep inventory: " + keepInventory);
   c.send("Random tick speed: " + randomTickSpeed);
        Parameters:
        gameRule - The name of the game rule to get the value of.
        Returns:
        The value of the game rule. The type of the value will match the expected type for the game rule.

      • setBlock

        void setBlock(IScriptBlockState state,
              int x,
              int y,
              int z)
        Set a block at XYZ, use IScriptFactory.createBlockState(String, int) to get the block state. 
        
    var coarse_dirt = mappet.createBlockState("minecraft:dirt", 1);

    c.getWorld().setBlock(coarse_dirt, 214, 3, 509);

                 int y,
                 int z)
        Remove a block at given XYZ. 
        
   c.getWorld().removeBlock(214, 3, 509);

      • getBlock

        IScriptBlockState getBlock(int x,
                           int y,
                           int z)
        Get block state at given XYZ. 
        
    var block = c.getWorld().getBlock(214, 3, 509);

    c.send("Block at (214, 3, 509) is " + block.getBlockId());
        Returns:
        a block state at given XYZ, or null if the chunk isn't loaded

      • getBlock

        IScriptBlockState getBlock(ScriptVector pos)
        Get block state at given XYZ. 
        
    var block = c.getWorld().getBlock(mappet.vector3(214, 3, 509));

    c.send("Block at (214, 3, 509) is " + block.getBlockId());
        Returns:
        a block state at given XYZ, or null if the chunk isn't loaded

     var hasTileEntity = c.getWorld().hasTileEntity(0, 80, 0)

 }

      • replaceBlocks

        void replaceBlocks(IScriptBlockState blockToBeReplaced,
                   IScriptBlockState newBlock,
                   Vector3d pos1,
                   Vector3d pos2)
        Replace all blocks in the given area with the given block state. 
        
 c.getWorld().replaceBlocks(
    mappet.createBlockState("minecraft:dirt", 0),
    mappet.createBlockState("minecraft:dirt", 1),
    mappet.vector3(214, 3, 509),
    mappet.vector3(214, 3, 509)
 );

      • replaceBlocks

        void replaceBlocks(IScriptBlockState blockToBeReplaced,
                   IScriptBlockState newBlock,
                   INBTCompound tileData,
                   Vector3d pos1,
                   Vector3d pos2)
        Replace all blocks in the given area with the given block state and tile entity data. 
        
 c.getWorld().replaceBlocks(
    mappet.createBlockState("minecraft:dirt", 0),
    mappet.createBlockState("blockbuster:model", 0),
    mappet.createCompound('{Morph:{Settings:{Hands:1b},Name:"blockbuster.fred"},id:"minecraft:blockbuster_model_tile_entity"}'),
    mappet.vector3(171, 61, 279),
    mappet.vector3(176, 64, 276)
 );

      • getTileEntity

        IScriptTileEntity getTileEntity(int x,
                                int y,
                                int z)
        Get tile entity at given XYZ. 
        
    var tile = c.getWorld().getTileEntity(214, 3, 509);

    if (tile)
    {
        c.send("Tile entity at (214, 3, 509) is " + tile.getId());
    }
    else
    {
        c.send("There is no tile entity at (214, 3, 509)");
    }

      • hasInventory

        boolean hasInventory(int x,
                     int y,
                     int z)
        Check whether there is an inventory tile entity at given XYZ. 
        
    var world = c.getWorld();

    if (world.hasInventory(214, 4, 512))
    {
        var inventory = world.getInventory(214, 4, 512);

        inventory.setStack(0, mappet.createItem("minecraft:diamond_hoe"));
        c.send("There is a surprise for you in chest at (214, 4, 512) :)");
    }
    else
    {
        c.send("There is no chest at (214, 4, 512)...");
    }

      • getInventory

        IScriptInventory getInventory(int x,
                              int y,
                              int z)
        Get inventory tile entity at given XYZ. 
        
    var world = c.getWorld();
    var inventory = world.getInventory(214, 4, 512);

    if (world.hasInventory(214, 4, 512))
    {
        var inventory = world.getInventory(214, 4, 512);

        inventory.clear();
    }
        Returns:
        an inventory at given XYZ, or null if an inventory tile entity isn't present.

      • isRaining

        boolean isRaining()
        Check whether it's raining in the world. 
        
    var world = c.getWorld();
    var pos = c.getSubject().getPosition();

    // If it's raining in the world, then drop a diamond
    // If not, then drop a dirt block
    if (world.isRaining())
    {
        world.dropItemStack(mappet.createItem("minecraft:diamond"), pos.x, pos.y + 3, pos.z);
    }
    else
    {
        world.dropItemStack(mappet.createItem("minecraft:dirt"), pos.x, pos.y + 3, pos.z);
    }

      • setRaining

        void setRaining(boolean raining)
        Set raining state. 
        
    c.getWorld().setRaining(true);
    c.send("The ritual dance got successfully completed!");

      • getTime

        long getTime()
        Get current time of day (the one that is set by /time set command). 
        
    if (c.getWorld().getTime() % 24000 > 12000)
    {
        c.getSubject().send("Good night!");
    }
    else
    {
        c.getSubject().send("Good day!");
    }

      • setTime

        void setTime(long time)
        Set current time of day. 
        
    c.getWorld().setTime(14000);
    c.send("Another ritual dance got successfully completed!");

      • getTotalTime

        long getTotalTime()
        Get total time that this world existed for (in ticks). 
        
    if (c.getWorld().getTotalTime() > 20 * 600)
    {
        c.send("You had only 10 minutes to complete the map...");
        c.send("Initiating SELF-DESTRUCT mode!");

        // TODO: implement self-destruction
    }

      • getDimensionId

        int getDimensionId()
        Get world's dimension ID. 
        
    if (c.getWorld().getDimensionId() == 0)
    {
        c.getSubject().send("You're in overworld!");
    }
    else
    {
        c.getSubject().send("*shrugs*");
    }

      • spawnParticles

        void spawnParticles(EnumParticleTypes type,
                    boolean longDistance,
                    double x,
                    double y,
                    double z,
                    int n,
                    double dx,
                    double dy,
                    double dz,
                    double speed,
                    int... args)
        Spawn vanilla particles. 
        
    var explode = mappet.getParticleType("explode");
    var pos = c.getSubject().getPosition();

    c.getWorld().spawnParticles(explode, false, pos.x, pos.y, pos.z, 10, 0.1, 0.1, 0.1, 0.1);
        Parameters:
        type - Particle type, you can use IScriptFactory.getParticleType(String) to get the desired particle type.
        longDistance - Whether particles should be spawned regardless of the distance
        x - X coordinate of position where particles should be spawned
        y - Y coordinate of position where particles should be spawned
        z - Z coordinate of position where particles should be spawned
        n - How many particles of given type should be spawned
        dx - X random offset that shift particle relative to X coordinate where it spawned
        dy - Y random offset that shift particle relative to Y coordinate where it spawned
        dz - Z random offset that shift particle relative to Z coordinate where it spawned
        speed - The speed of particle, different particles might use this argument differently
        args - Additional arguments that can be passed into a particle, for example for "iconcrack" particle you can pass item numeric ID to spawn item particle for a specific item (F3 + H shows the numeric ID of an item)

      • spawnParticles

        void spawnParticles(IScriptPlayer player,
                    EnumParticleTypes type,
                    boolean longDistance,
                    double x,
                    double y,
                    double z,
                    int n,
                    double dx,
                    double dy,
                    double dz,
                    double speed,
                    int... args)
        Spawn vanilla particles only to a specific player. 
        
    var explode = mappet.getParticleType("explode");
    var pos = c.getSubject().getPosition();

    c.getWorld().spawnParticles(c.getSubject(), explode, false, pos.x, pos.y, pos.z, 10, 0.1, 0.1, 0.1, 0.1);
        Parameters:
        player - The player that you want to limit seeing the particle only to
        type - Particle type, you can use IScriptFactory.getParticleType(String) to get the desired particle type.
        longDistance - Whether particles should be spawned regardless of the distance
        x - X coordinate of position where particles should be spawned
        y - Y coordinate of position where particles should be spawned
        z - Z coordinate of position where particles should be spawned
        n - How many particles of given type should be spawned
        dx - X random offset that shift particle relative to X coordinate where it spawned
        dy - Y random offset that shift particle relative to Y coordinate where it spawned
        dz - Z random offset that shift particle relative to Z coordinate where it spawned
        speed - The speed of particle, different particles might use this argument differently
        args - Additional arguments that can be passed into a particle, for example for "iconcrack" particle you can pass item numeric ID to spawn item particle for a specific item (F3 + H shows the numeric ID of an item)

      • spawnEntity

        default IScriptEntity spawnEntity(java.lang.String id,
                                  double x,
                                  double y,
                                  double z)
        Spawn an entity at given position. 
        
    var pos = c.getSubject().getPosition();

    // Make an explosion at player's feet
    c.getWorld().spawnEntity("minecraft:tnt", pos.x, pos.y, pos.z);

      • spawnEntity

        IScriptEntity spawnEntity(java.lang.String id,
                          double x,
                          double y,
                          double z,
                          INBTCompound compound)
        Spawn an entity at given position with additional data. 
        
    var pos = c.getSubject().getPosition();

    // Spawn a baby zombie
    c.getWorld().spawnEntity("minecraft:zombie", pos.x, pos.y + 3, pos.z, mappet.createCompound("{IsBaby:1b}"));

                            double x,
                            double y,
                            double z)
        Spawn an NPC at given position with default state. 
        
    var pos = c.getSubject().getPosition();

    c.getWorld().spawnNpc("herobrine", pos.x, pos.y, pos.z);

      • spawnNpc

        IScriptNpc spawnNpc(java.lang.String id,
                    java.lang.String state,
                    double x,
                    double y,
                    double z)
        Spawn an NPC at given position with given state. 
        
    var pos = c.getSubject().getPosition();

    c.getWorld().spawnNpc("herobrine", "dabbing", pos.x, pos.y, pos.z);

      • spawnNpc

        IScriptNpc spawnNpc(java.lang.String id,
                    java.lang.String state,
                    double x,
                    double y,
                    double z,
                    float yaw,
                    float pitch,
                    float headYaw)
        Spawn an NPC at given position with given state and rotation. 
        
    var pos = c.getSubject().getPosition();

    c.getWorld().spawnNpc("herobrine", "dabbing", pos.x, pos.y, pos.z, 0, 0, 0);

      • getEntities

        java.util.List<IScriptEntity> getEntities(double x1,
                                          double y1,
                                          double z1,
                                          double x2,
                                          double y2,
                                          double z2)
        Get entities within the box specified by given coordinates in this world. This method limits to scanning entities only within 100 blocks in any direction. If the box provided has any of its sizes that is longer than 100 blocks, then it will simply return an empty list. 
        
    // Y position is at the feet, while X and Z is at center
    var pos = c.getSubject().getPosition();
    var entities = c.getWorld().getEntities(pos.x - 2, pos.y - 1, pos.z - 2, pos.x + 2, pos.y + 3, pos.z + 2);

    for (var i in entities)
    {
        var entity = entities[i];

        if (!entity.isSame(c.getSubject()))
        {
            entity.damage(2.0);
        }
    }

      • getEntities

        java.util.List<IScriptEntity> getEntities(double x1,
                                          double y1,
                                          double z1,
                                          double x2,
                                          double y2,
                                          double z2,
                                          boolean ignoreVolumeLimit)
        Get entities within the box specified by given coordinates in this world ignoring the volume limit. This method does not limit to scanning entities only within 100 blocks 
        
    // Y position is at the feet, while X and Z is at center
    var pos = c.getSubject().getPosition();
    var entities = c.getWorld().getEntities(pos.x - 30, pos.y - 30, pos.z - 30, pos.x + 30, pos.y + 30, pos.z + 30, true);

    for (var i in entities)
    {
        var entity = entities[i];

        if (!entity.isSame(c.getSubject()))
        {
            entity.damage(2.0);
        }
    }

      • getEntities

        java.util.List<IScriptEntity> getEntities(double x,
                                          double y,
                                          double z,
                                          double radius)
        Get entities within the sphere specified by given coordinates and radius in this world. This method limits to scanning entities only within 50 blocks radius in any direction. If the sphere provided has the radius that is longer than 100 blocks, then it will simply return an empty list. 
        
    var pos = c.getSubject().getPosition();
    var entities = c.getWorld().getEntities(pos.x, pos.y + 1, pos.z, 3);

    for (var i in entities)
    {
        var entity = entities[i];

        if (!entity.isSame(c.getSubject()))
        {
            entity.damage(2.0);
        }
    }

      • playSound

        default void playSound(java.lang.String event,
                       double x,
                       double y,
                       double z)
        Play a sound event in the world.

        For all possible sound event IDs, please refer to either /playsound command, or script editor's sound picker.

        
    var pos = c.getSubject().getPosition();

    c.getWorld().playSound("minecraft:entity.pig.ambient", pos.x, pos.y, pos.z);

      • playSound

        void playSound(java.lang.String event,
               double x,
               double y,
               double z,
               float volume,
               float pitch)
        Play a sound event in the world with volume and pitch. 
        
    var pos = c.getSubject().getPosition();

    c.getWorld().playSound("minecraft:entity.pig.ambient", pos.x, pos.y, pos.z, 1.0, 0.8);

      • stopAllSounds

        default void stopAllSounds()
        Stop all playing sound events for every player. 
        
    c.getWorld().stopAllSounds();

      • stopSound

        default void stopSound(java.lang.String event)
        Stop specific sound event for every player. 
        
    c.getWorld().stopSound("minecraft:entity.pig.ambient");

      • stopSound

        void stopSound(java.lang.String event,
               java.lang.String category)

        Stop specific sound event in given sound category for every player.

        For list of sound categories, type into chat /playsound minecraft:entity.pig.ambient, press space, and press Tab key. The list of sounds categories will be displayed.

        
    c.getWorld().stopSound("minecraft:entity.pig.ambient", "master");

      • dropItemStack

        default IScriptEntityItem dropItemStack(IScriptItemStack stack,
                                        double x,
                                        double y,
                                        double z)
        Drop item stack at given XYZ position with no velocity applied. 
        
    var item = mappet.createItem("minecraft:diamond_hoe");
    var pos = c.getSubject().getPosition();

    c.getWorld().dropItemStack(item, pos.x, pos.y + 3, pos.z);

      • explode

        default void explode(double x,
                     double y,
                     double z,
                     float distance)
        Make an explosion in this world at given coordinates, and distance that destroys blocks, damages entities but not places fire. See explode(IScriptEntity, double, double, double, float, boolean, boolean) for more thorough definition of arguments. 
        
 function main(c)
 {
     var s = c.getSubject();
     var pos = s.getPosition();

     c.getWorld().explode(pos.x, pos.y, pos.z, 10)
 }

      • explode

        default void explode(double x,
                     double y,
                     double z,
                     float distance,
                     boolean blazeGround,
                     boolean destroyTerrain)
        Make an explosion in this world at given coordinates, and distance with options to place fire and destroy blocks. See explode(IScriptEntity, double, double, double, float, boolean, boolean) for more thorough definition of arguments. 
        
 function main(c)
 {
     var s = c.getSubject();
     var pos = s.getPosition();

     c.getWorld().explode(pos.x, pos.y, pos.z, 10, false, false)
 }

      • explode

        void explode(IScriptEntity exploder,
             double x,
             double y,
             double z,
             float distance,
             boolean blazeGround,
             boolean destroyTerrain)
        Make an explosion in this world at given coordinates, distance, and entity that caused the explosion. 
        
 function main(c)
 {
     var s = c.getSubject();
     var pos = s.getPosition();

     c.getWorld().explode(s, pos.x, pos.y, pos.z, 10, false, false)
 }
        Parameters:
        exploder - Entity that causes explosion that won't receive damage from it.
        x - X coordinate in the world at which explosion must be caused.
        y - Y coordinate in the world at which explosion must be caused.
        z - Z coordinate in the world at which explosion must be caused.
        distance - Radius (in blocks of the explosion).
        blazeGround - Whether fire blocks should be placed randomly on top of remaining blocks.
        destroyTerrain - Whether blocks should be destroyed by the explosion.

      • testForBlock

        boolean testForBlock(int x,
                     int y,
                     int z,
                     java.lang.String blockId,
                     int meta)
        Test for a specific block and meta in a specific coordinates. 
        
     function main(c)
     {
         var pos = c.getSubject().getPosition()

         if (c.getWorld().testForBlock(Math.floor(pos.x), Math.floor(pos.y), Math.floor(pos.z), "minecraft:light_weighted_pressure_plate", 1))
         {
             c.send("Prussure Plate is pressed.")
         }
     }

      • getBlockStackWithTile

        IScriptItemStack getBlockStackWithTile(int x,
                                       int y,
                                       int z)
        Gets the block stack at given position, including tile entity data. 
        
    var x= 0, y = 100, z = 0;
    var world = c.getWorld();
    var blockItemStack = world.getBlockStackWithTile(x, y, z);
    world.setBlock(mappet.createBlockState("minecraft:air", 0), x, y, z)
    world.dropItemStack(blockItemStack, x+0.5, y+0.5, z+0.5);

      • displayMorph

        default void displayMorph(AbstractMorph morph,
                          int expiration,
                          double x,
                          double y,
                          double z)
        Display a world morph to all players around 64 blocks away from given point. 
        
 function main(c)
 {
     var s = c.getSubject();
     var morph = mappet.createMorph('{Name:"item"}');
     var pos = s.getPosition();

     c.getWorld().displayMorph(morph, 100, pos.x, pos.y + s.getHeight() + 0.5, pos.z);
 }

      • displayMorph

        default void displayMorph(AbstractMorph morph,
                          int expiration,
                          double x,
                          double y,
                          double z,
                          int range)
        Display a world morph to all players at given point. 
        
    var s = c.getSubject();
    var morph = mappet.createMorph('{Name:"item"}');
    var pos = s.getPosition();

    // This will display a diamond hoe morph on top of the
    // player's head (but it won't track player's movement)
    c.getWorld().displayMorph(morph, 100, pos.x, pos.y + s.getHeight() + 0.5, pos.z, 64);
        Parameters:
        morph - Morph that will be displayed (if null, then it won't send anything).
        expiration - For how many ticks will this displayed morph exist on the client side.
        range - How many blocks far away will this send to players around given point.

      • displayMorph

        default void displayMorph(AbstractMorph morph,
                          int expiration,
                          double x,
                          double y,
                          double z,
                          float yaw,
                          float pitch)
        Display a world morph to all players at given point with rotation. 
        
    var s = c.getSubject();
    var morph = mappet.createMorph('{Name:"item"}');
    var pos = s.getPosition();

    // This will display a diamond hoe morph on top of the
    // player's head (but it won't track player's movement)
    // oriented at west
    c.getWorld().displayMorph(morph, 100, pos.x, pos.y + s.getHeight() + 0.5, pos.z, 90, 0);
        Parameters:
        morph - Morph that will be displayed (if null, then it won't send anything).
        expiration - For how many ticks will this displayed morph exist on the client side.
        yaw - Horizontal rotation in degrees.
        pitch - Vertical rotation in degrees.

      • displayMorph

        default void displayMorph(AbstractMorph morph,
                          int expiration,
                          double x,
                          double y,
                          double z,
                          float yaw,
                          float pitch,
                          int range)
        Display a world morph to all players at given point with rotation some blocks away in this world. 
        
 function main(c)
 {
     var s = c.getSubject();
     var morph = mappet.createMorph('{Name:"item"}');
     var pos = s.getPosition();

     var yaw = s.getYaw()
     var pitch = s.getPitch()

     c.getWorld().displayMorph(morph, 100, pos.x, pos.y + s.getHeight() + 0.5, pos.z, yaw, pitch, 90);
 }
        Parameters:
        morph - Morph that will be displayed (if null, then it won't send anything).
        expiration - For how many ticks will this displayed morph exist on the client side.
        yaw - Horizontal rotation in degrees.
        pitch - Vertical rotation in degrees.
        range - How many blocks far away will this send to players around given point.

      • displayMorph

        void displayMorph(AbstractMorph morph,
                  int expiration,
                  double x,
                  double y,
                  double z,
                  float yaw,
                  float pitch,
                  int range,
                  IScriptPlayer player)
        Display a world morph to all players at given point with rotation some blocks away in this world only to given player. 
        
 function main(c)
 {
     var s = c.getSubject();
     var morph = mappet.createMorph('{Name:"item"}');
     var pos = s.getPosition();

     var yaw = s.getYaw()
     var pitch = s.getPitch()

     c.getWorld().displayMorph(morph, 100, pos.x, pos.y + s.getHeight() + 0.5, pos.z, yaw, pitch, 90, s);
 }
        Parameters:
        morph - Morph that will be displayed (if null, then it won't send anything).
        expiration - For how many ticks will this displayed morph exist on the client side.
        yaw - Horizontal rotation in degrees.
        pitch - Vertical rotation in degrees.
        range - How many blocks far away will this send to players around given point.
        player - The player that only should see the morph, or null for everyone.

      • shootBBGunProjectile

        IScriptEntity shootBBGunProjectile(IScriptEntity shooter,
                                   double x,
                                   double y,
                                   double z,
                                   double yaw,
                                   double pitch,
                                   java.lang.String gunPropsNbtString)
        Shoots a gun projectile entity. 
        
     var projectile = c.getWorld().shootBBGunProjectile(c.getSubject(), 547, 160, 497, 0, -90, '{Gun:{TickCommand:"particle heart ~ ~1 ~ 0.2 0.2 0.2 1",StoredAmmo:0,Ticking:1,Damage:1.0f,Projectile:{Meta:0b,Block:"minecraft:stone",Name:"block"},Gravity:0.0f}}')
     c.scheduleScript(20, function (c){
         projectile.executeCommand("summon tnt ~ ~ ~")
         projectile.remove()
     });
